results.source: Fandom wiki / Novel Updates (implied from 'Mada' romanization)
results.note: 卿 (kyou) translates to 'Lord' or 'Sir', not 'Doctor'. While 'マーダー' could be romanized as 'Mada', the title 'Doctor' is not supported by '卿'. If the character is a doctor, it's not indicated by 卿. If 'Mada' is the intended name, then 'Lord Mada' would be the correct translation of the title. No official J-Novel Club spelling found.

results.source: Reddit r/manga discussion (fan consensus based on official translation context)
Contextual inference from official synopsis (mention of 'third son') and common translation usage
results.note: The protagonist is the 'third son' (Saryu), implying the existence of a second eldest brother who would be the 'Second Prince'. While not explicitly named in official English synopses found, 'Second Prince' is the standard translation for 次兄 in a royal context.
